text: As we continue to celebrate #PrideMonth, my message is simple: We’ve come a long way, but there’s still more work to do to ensure equal rights for LGBTQ+ Americans. https://t.co/OBwMF8usbo

Today marks 78 years since #DDay when thousands of Allied and American soldiers stormed the beaches of Normandy in their heroic fight against the Nazis. Let us always remember their sacrifice and the price of freedom. https://t.co/V5Cv9qPN6b

Last year, troops based out of Stewart Air National Guard Base performed heroically when called upon during Operation Allies Refuge. They saved thousands of lives and it was a privilege to honor them this weekend with medals for their service and bravery. https://t.co/9tV19rn9Zd

Congratulations to the New York Military Academy Class of 2022! It was my honor to deliver the commencement address to the corps of cadets today. 

As I told them: with the leadership skills they've learned at the Academy, the future is what they make it. https://t.co/E86zzBFJIj

After hearing from local firefighters about the health challenges they face, from COVID-19 to hazardous fumes, I got to work with my colleagues on two bills to ensure all federal firefighters get the benefits and protections they deserve. Learn more about these important bills ⬇️ https://t.co/bLpWoYxf2U

Today we #WearOrange to honor victims and survivors of gun violence. Truly honoring them means passing commonsense gun laws that will save lives. @HouseDemocrats already passed H.R. 8, and it’s past time for Senate Republicans to take action to #EndGunViolence.

Today, we celebrated the incredible students from across NY-18 who were appointed to U.S. Service Academies this year. They represent the best and brightest, and it's a blessing for our nation that they have chosen to serve. Congratulations to the appointees and their families! https://t.co/2URMk991Ba
